radiographic_examinations.findings: A millimetric perifissural nodule on the left is likely a lymph node. The included lung bases show no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. The liver enhances homogeneously without focal lesions. The gallbladder is normal with no biliary ductal dilation. The spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable. The kidneys enhance symmetrically with no hydronephrosis and there is a duplicated right renal collecting system. The base of the appendix is dilated to 9 mm with para-appendiceal stranding. No extraluminal air, abscess, or free fluid present. The bladder, uterus, and rectum are normal.
